official-title.#text:
To require the Secretary of the Interior to transfer all Federal land, facilities, and any other
			 assets associated with the Ozark National Scenic Riverways to the State of
			 Missouri for the purposes of maintaining a State park, and for other
			 purposes.

sponsor.#tail: introduced the following bill; which was referred to the

text.#text:
The Ozark National Scenic Riverways was created under the auspices of protecting public access to
			 the area indefinitely.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
has begun to prevent members of the public from accessing the lands that
			 compose the park.

text.#text:
The State of Missouri is able to maintain the park and ensure that it continues in substantially
			 the same fashion as it has while maintaining public access.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, is amended by adding at the end the
			 following:

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
An Act to provide for the establishment of the Ozark National Scenic Riverways in the State of
			 Missouri, and for other purposes

header.#text: Conveyance of Ozark National Scenic Riverways

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall convey
			 to the State of Missouri, for no consideration, all right, title, and
			 interest of the United States in and to all Federal land, facilities, and
			 any other assets associated with the Ozark National Scenic Riverways,
			 subject to the following conditions:

text.#text: Not later than one year after the date of the enactment of this section, the
The Federal Government shall pay all of the costs of the conveyance under this section.

A covenant or restriction shall be in the deed to the land and facilities conveyed under this
			 section requiring—

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
on the day before the date of the enactment of
			 this section;

text.#text:
that the State of Missouri shall maintain and operate the land, facilities, and assets conveyed
			 under this section, at the cost to the State, in substantially the same
			 fashion as such land, facilities, and assets were being maintained by the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, at
			 no cost to the United States;

text.#text:
that if the State of Missouri attempts to sell, in whole or in part, the land, facilities, or
			 assets conveyed under this section, such the land, facilities, and assets
			 shall revert to the United States, at the discretion of the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, the land and facilities shall revert to the United
			 States, at the discretion of the

, at no cost to the United
			 States; and

text.#text: that if the land and facilities conveyed under this section are no longer used as described in
any other terms and conditions that the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall not apply during any period during
			 which title to the land associated with the Ozark National Scenic
			 Riverways is not held by the United States.

{http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/}title.#text: 113 HR 4029 IH: To require the Secretary of the Interior to transfer all Federal land, facilities, and any other assets associated with the Ozark National Scenic Riverways to the State of Missouri for the purposes of maintaining a State park, and for other purposes.
